Items.Name: Jira: Synchronization is failed: Unable to retrieve issue type id.
idea for integrating Visual Studio with TP
Items.Description:
What I meant was it would be nice if Target Process integrated better with Visual Studio, i.e. the way Team Foundation Server integrated with Visual Studio.

With TFS, when I check in a file, it prompts me for comments, but also present a list of tasks that I can check in the code change against. I can have a checkin Policy that forces a task to be selected.

 

If TargetProcess, could present the tasks assigned to you in the SVN checkin Process, rather then having to type in "#Task1 Status:Closed" ... it could just make the checking process so much easier.

 

The Task based Checking is one of the main features for a me as a development manager, so that I can isolate the scope of a task ...i.e. how many files needed to be touched, so anything that can make it easier for the developer to select the task would be great.

Items.Name: Improvement to Visual Studio Add-in - Show total time against each item
Items.Description:
Show total time recorded against each item on the ToDo list. If the total is made of more than one record then the detail records should be made available. e.g. via a pop-up or expander.

I should clarify this by saying I'm talking about dispaying against each item the time that has been recorded for that item using the timer functionality of the add-in clock but has not been submitted to TP. At the moment the add-in only gives you the total time recorded across all items in the ToDo list.

Items.Name: Time tracker outside VS
Items.Description:
I think it would be ince to prapare some standalone time tracking tool (simular to the Visual Studio plugin).
Something where the user could just select a task, press START TRACKING and then after some time press STOP and automatically update the time at the server.
It could be build into the server as well: For instance when START is being pressed server could save the task in progress and the start time...and than when pressing STOP it could the time and seve it to the task.

Is there any feature like this?

Items.Name: Visual Studio Plugin
Items.Description:
Hello,

I have a request for an upgrade. Our company is dealing with the outside work force in development and we have major problem of our developers marking up their time in Visual Studio against our budget. Visual studio plugin is already giving option of clocking in and out based on the task list, however its doing it manually. It would be nice if this same plugin is doing automatic clock in and clock out based on actual work on each task without user interaction. Is there is time when the application notices that there is no activity on the task to also mark this time as work but give an option to the developer to write in the comment what he was doing during the idle time. AKA, research outside of Visual studio, searching for scripts online and similar. I believe this would be a nice feature for companies like ours that dos not have control over the the developers and are paying based on hours spent on development.  

Best regards,

Toni B Beretin

Items.Name: Release/Iteration column in the todo list for the VS plugin

Items.Name: Shift the iteration plan by x days
Items.Description:
If I have to change the start of an iteration(due to holidays or other resorcing issues)
I have to change every single iteration after that.
It takes a long time for projects with multiple iterations.
Can TP add the ability to 'time shift' a release by 'x' days. It would work something like the following:
 
When I change iteration/team iteration start date or duration
Then shift all future iterations by the same amount of days.
If some iteration starts on Weekend (Sunday)
Then ignore weekend and start iteration on Sunday
 
If there are some holes between iterations, fill this holes first (don't move future iterations)

Items.Name: IMAP protocol support for inbound email integration
SSL/TLS (gmail) SMTP email configuration
Items.Description:
I would like to be able to send emails using either my hosted Exchange account or through a gmail account.  In order to do this, not only is authentication necessary (which TargetProcess already supports), but encryption using SSL/TLS to each SMTP server.

Currently, there is no (obvious) support for this in TargetProcess and I don't see anything on the forums or documentation relating to it.  Since unauthenticated SMTP servers are extremely rare now, for fear of spam relays, is this just an oversight on my part?  Is there a way to enable this?
